name: workings
content:
workings noun [plural]
(UNDER GROUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the system of holes that has been dug in the ground in order to remove metal, coal, etc.: disused mine workings
More examplesFewer examplesWhat I need is a book that will demystify the workings of a car engine for me.Psychologists focus on the workings of the nervous system, especially the brain.She has a keen interest in the workings of government.The novel portrayed the despair of an ordinary man entangled in the workings of a bureaucratic legal system.The process is crucial to the workings of the living cell.

workings noun [plural]
(CALCULATIONS)
UK the calculations you do in order to reach an answer to a mathematical problem: show your workings Lay out numerical solutions clearly, spacing out each stage and showing your workings.

workings noun [plural]
(OPERATION)
the workings of something
the way that an organization, machine, or organism operates: the workings of government
See more
Add to word list
Add to word list
the way something, such as an organization or machine, does what it is intended to do: Powerful microscopes reveal the inner workings of cells.
